definitions.definition: The act of flowing or proceeding (of something, quality, or feeling) from a source or origin.
That which issues, flows, or proceeds from any object as a source; efflux ; an effluence .
examples: Perfume is an emanation from a flower.

definitions.definition: The generation of the Son and the procession of the Holy Spirit , as distinct from the origination of created beings.

main_definition: The act of flowing or proceeding (of something, quality, or feeling) from a source or origin.
secondary_definitions: That which issues, flows, or proceeds from any object as a source; efflux ; an effluence .
( uncountable , obsolete ) ( physics , chemistry ) The element radon ( Rn )
( theology ) The generation of the Son and the procession of the Holy Spirit , as distinct from the origination of created beings.
